intro: Taraxacum ceratophorum subsp. cornutum, commonly known as the horned dandelion, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiky bracts that surround the flower head, giving it a unique appearance. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in grassy areas and disturbed soils. Its leaves are typically hairy and form a basal rosette, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
